info.name: Cisco ISE API - MNT
info.description:
# Cisco ISE API - MNT

ISE Monitoring and Troubleshooting (MnT) API resources up to and including ISE 3.0.

## License
[Cisco Sample Code License](https://developer.cisco.com/site/license/cisco-sample-code-license/)

## Documentation
See the complete documentation for the [Cisco ISE Monitoring REST APIs](https://cs.co/ise-api).

## Environment Variables
This collection uses environment variables in scripts in the **Tests** tab to store data (`id`, `name`, `portalId`, etc.)  between requests. This allows you to `GET` or `POST` then immediately `GET {id}` on a resource. Using **No Environment** will cause this convenience functionality to fail so be sure to choose one.


## Collection Variables 
This collection uses collection variables that you will want to *update* or *override* with your own environment variables for your ISE deployment.

request.description:
## ActiveCount
Lists the number of active sessions.

`https://<ISE>/admin/API/mnt/Session/ActiveCount`

request.description:
Enter the date and time for the `start_time` and `end_time` relative to the ISE node's time (recommended is UTC) in the following format: `null` or `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.s`
where:
- `YYYY` : four-digit year
- `MM` : two-digit month (01=January, etc.)
- `DD` : two-digit day of the month (01-31)
- `hh` : two-digit hour (00-23)
- `mm` : two-digit minute (00-59)
- `ss` : two-digit second (00-59)
- `s` : one or more digits representing a decimal fraction of a second

request.description:
## Session by MACAddress
Searches the database for the latest session that contains the specified MAC address. The MAC address format is `XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX ` and is not case sensitive (0a:0B:0c:0D:0e:0F). The MAC address serves as the only unique key to finding the correct session you want to monitor.

`https://<ISE>/admin/API/mnt/Session/MACAddress/<macaddress>`

response.name: 00:00:00:00:00:00 (not found)

request.description:
## Session by UserName
Searches the database for the latest session that contains the specified username. Usernames must conform to the same policy used for network usernames. The only invalid character for the Monitoring REST APIs is the backslash (\) character.

`https://<ISE>/admin/API/mnt/Session/UserName/<username>`

request.description:
Node Type:
- `0` : STAND_ALONE_MNT_NODE means it is a Monitoring node that does not function in any distributed deployment.
- `1` : ACTIVE_MNT_NODE means it is a primary node in a primary-secondary relationship in a distributed deployment.
- `2` : STAND_BY_MNT_NODE means it is a secondary node in a primary-secondary pair in a distributed deployment.
- `3` : NOT_AN_MNT_NODE means it is not a Monitoring node. See Cisco Identity Services Engine User Guide, Release 1.1 for details about the supported ISE nodes and personas.

request.description:
## Session Disconnect
Sends a session disconnect command and port option type. You must know the endpoint MAC address to perform this API call but you can leave other parameters as `null`.

`https://<ise>/admin/API/mnt/CoA/Disconnect/<serverhostname>/<macaddress>/<disconnecttype>/<nasipaddress>/<destinationipaddress>`

Port Disconnect Type:
- `0` : DYNAMIC_AUTHZ_PORT_DEFAULT
- `1` : DYNAMIC_AUTHZ_PORT_BOUNCE
- `2` : DYNAMIC_AUTHZ_PORT_SHUTDOWN

request.description:
## AcctStatus
Lists the accounting status of all sessions within a specific period of time.

`https://<ISEhost>/admin/API/mnt/AcctStatusTT/MACAddress/<macaddress>/<numberofseconds>`

- numberofseconds` : the valid range is 0 - 432000 seconds (5 days)
